items.name: Pizza Marinara
items.description: This is a traditional Neapolitan pizza that is made with lots of garlic, anchovies and oregano.

items.name: Pizza Pugliese
items.description: This is another great pizza that is made using olives from the area and local capers. It is also topped with onions, mozzarella and tomatoes.

items.name: Pizza Capricciosa
items.description: This pizza is topped with olives, artichoke hearts, half of a boiled egg, prosciutto and mushrooms.

items.name: Pizza Veronese
items.description: This one is made simply with Prosciutto crudo and mushrooms.

items.name: Pizza Romana
items.description: This is a pizza that contains anchovies, capperi, mozzarella and tomatoes.

items.name: Liguria Pizza
items.description: This one has a topping of basil pesto and does not have a tomato sauce.

items.name: Nigiri
items.description: A topping, usually fish, served on top of sushi rice

items.name: Sashimi
items.description: Fish or shellfish served alone (no rice)

items.name: Maki
items.description: Rice and filling wrapped in seaweed

items.name: Uramaki
items.description: Similar to the above, but rice is on the outside and seaweed wraps around the filling

items.name: Temaki
items.description: Sushi that has been hand-rolled into a cone shape

items.name: Cabernet sauvignon
items.description: Full-bodied with herbal notes. Younger cab has rich flavors of currant.

items.name: Merlot
items.description: Fruity, spicy. Very soft, less tannic than Cabernet sauvignon.

items.name: Pinot noir
items.description: Delicate and fresh, very soft tannins with fruity aromas.

items.name: Zinfandel
items.description: Typically zesty, ranges from medium- to full-bodied and dry to off-dry.

items.name: Riesling
items.description: Usually very sweet, with intense fruit flavors. Much lighter than chardonnay.
